website_summaries.verdict: Despite its limitations, this minimalist RFID-blocking wallet is worth considering if your top priority is a thin design that doesn't add a lot of bulk to your pockets.
pros: Ultra-slim design easily fits in a front pocket
Can fit several cards and a few bills
Has a finger slot that makes it easy to slide out cards
Style is suitable for men and women
cons: Some reports of seams coming loose over time
Not ideal if you have a lot of cards to carry

customer_reviews.title: Great, low profile wallet!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this wallet. I was replacing a worn out traditional folding wallet, which my cards fell out of, and it was too bulky. I looked at few different ones on here and went with this one. It’s awesome. Slips into my front pocket, it’s lightbweight, holds all my cards. I only carry four. I really like the favorite card slot. I can easily access my debit card using one hand. It has a clear window ID slot. It has two slots for cash or a biz card, etc. it’s great not carrying a bulky, big wallet. It’s very well made too!
customer_reviews.author: D. Swan

customer_reviews.title: Catastrophic Failure: Month 8
customer_reviews.text: I loved this wallet. It’s slim and relatively well built. Relatively. This wallet was perfect until month 8. Then every closed seam popped. See pictures; all of those seams are on the “closed” end of the wallet. I contacted the seller to take advantage of the warranty. They quickly replied not to worry and to send my address. I have not received a response since sending my address or following-up to ask if they sent it. It has been 3 weeks. If they responded, this would be 5 stars. Instead, I just ordered a competitor’s product. I will update if mfr responds, I promise!
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Customer Service and Product
customer_reviews.text: Buffway offers a 12-month free replacement guarantee... Because I over-stuffed the pockets, my wallet started to rip literally a year & a month after I purchased it. EVEN THOUGH I WAS PAST THE WARRANTY/REPLACEMENT DATE, BUFFWAY STILL REPLACED IT FOR ME! Amazing product, amazing company, and AMAZING customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Veldsman

customer_reviews.title: After way too much research I chose this for a ...
customer_reviews.text: After way too much research I chose this for a European backpacking trip, so I could leave my fat old overstuffed wallet at home. This thing swallowed numerous credit cards, work id, driving license and cash, and I'm still checking every ten minutes as my pocket feels weird without that familiar bulge in it. I'm converted and don't think I'm going back to the "classic" wallet after the trip.
customer_reviews.author: RicH

customer_reviews.title: Super thin minimalist wallet, but durable and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. It shipped in a bubble pouch mailer, it was so thin I could barely feel it inside the pouch. The quality is excellent, nice light brown color calf leather and well stitched. Easily holds 10 cards, has 2 money pockets and drivers license holder. Holds cards snug. The cutout on bottom of 1st card pocket aids in removing card by pushing it up. Excellent minimalist wallet, it is thinner with all my cards and money than my other wallet empty! Great for front pocket carry. I wear athletic shorts in summer that don't have back pockets, so this works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Warranty’s a scam
customer_reviews.text: I loved this wallet up until the point it started falling apart. It’s only been a few months, so I thought I could use the warranty. I’ve been trying to obtain the warranty exchange, but no luck. The warranty was a huge selling point for me, so that’s pretty frustrating. I’ll keep this review at 1-star until someone fulfills a warranty request.
customer_reviews.author: MathiasR

customer_reviews.title: Great value on slim wallet
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased. I was looking for slim and I got it. I like that both sides have the finger groove to slide a card/ID out. Ability to pull my ID out easy was my biggest desire given issues with my previous wallet. My ID does stick (static cling) sometimes. If it not clear in the picture, there are 8 slots, including the middle pocket which is deep enough to hold folded dollars or Euros. Construction looks solid and stitching is neatly done. I have been using a for a week now, more to follow as we see how it stands up to daily use.
customer_reviews.author: JWR

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this wallet
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for, at a good price. Very compact with card slots on both sides. A nice design feature is the hole to help push out the windowed id card when necessary; there's a smaller hole on the reverse side for one of the credit card slots. I own a very expensive designer wallet with poorly designed slots that were almost impossible to get cards out of. No such problem with this wallet. I ordered it in yellow and am pleased with the color. Leather seems to be good quality; time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Love These Thin Wallets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wallet to replace another one that I had which was becoming a bit worn. Compare to the older wallet from another brand, the leather does seem to be stiffer. I am not sure whether it is due to its newness or not. Time will tell. I do love the finger hole to help slide the third credit card in and out. In my old wallet, the third card was always the hardest to get out. Like others mentioned, the Buffway is is bit thicker than my older wallet but it is not significant. Overall, very pleased with the purchase. Got it on a lightning deal - a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: ChicFlic

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising, NOT RFID PROOF
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim design and the price, but I really hate false advertising. It is not RFID proof. I can still unlock doors with my scanning card from the oppisite side of the wallet. No part of this wallet has any RFID protection.
customer_reviews.author: D.Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Came apart
customer_reviews.text: Great wallet until it started to come apart right by the window within 6 months of use. Other than that it’s great but now I need to buy another wallet and it won’t be one I have to replace so soon. Normally they last me years. Looked to contact the seller but don’t see that in the app so...
customer_reviews.author: Biff Stiffrock

customer_reviews.title: Meh.... tried it. Upgrading after a week
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Not great. I'm a minimalist and after a week with this wallet, I'm deciding to go with a carbon fiber one instead. As well as a matching carbon fiber key holder. This wallet was just too flimsy for me and the plastic window is starting to come apart. I'll keep it for a secondary holder. Fishing license, Casino cards, etc... things I hardly use but won't carry in my daily wallet. I gave it a try but it's not me. I can't see it lasting long. I also love the RFID feature with the new wallet I'm getting.
customer_reviews.author: David Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: RFID shielding questionable
customer_reviews.text: The reason why I bought this Buffway Slim Minimalist wallet was for the advertised RFID shield feature. I tested it by placing a card in the outer slot and paid for an item by placing the wallet close to the scanner at checkout. Something is wrong here ... FAULTY WALLET or FALSE ADVERTISING? I called Amazon customer support and the agent I spoke with was very professional, listened to what I had to say and offered to replace wallet as it may have been a defective. I declined a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for vacation last August. Used it for a month and put away. Starting using it again a month ago. Credit cards pockets are ripping at the bottom. Only lasted thru three months of use. I used my last wallet for seven years and it's still in one piece. I would not recommend this it is junk
customer_reviews.author: the red cup

customer_reviews.title: This bill fold lets you escape the "wallet wad" you have been sitting on!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this wallet for about a month, and it has transformed me! 1. No more sitting on a thick "wallet wad"! 2. As thin as this is, it still has 7 compartments for credit, insurance and identity cards, plus a larger one for your bills. I have something in every compartment and still the wallet is only a half inch thick (12-13mm). It is still very small and comfortable in any pocket. 3. My son now thinks I have gone from nerdy to Cool! 4. It is very well made, and every joint and seam is stitched, not glued
customer_reviews.author: Marvin F. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good basic wallet but it's false advertising
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it works for a solid basic wallet. I ratung it three stars because it is advising for features that are not true. The RFID protection does not work. The wallet says it's genuine leather but the materials being used is mainly nylon with patches leather. Having mainly nylon isn't bad but there not enough leather to justify "genuine leather" in my opinion. That being said if you are looking for a cheap minimalist wallet that store up to 10 cards then it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chrit S

customer_reviews.title: disappointed. I think this is misrepresented
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this, the description said RFID blocking.... received it today. Wallet ok, but nowhere on the wallet, in the wallet or the plastic bag that it came in does it say RFID blocking. plastic bag only says says BW-WL-VC-BR made in China /. disappointed. I think this is misrepresented.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Markoski

customer_reviews.title: This new wallet is thinner full with everything from my previous wallet, then the old one empty!!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this new thin wallet. I was able to get all my cards, money and drivers license in this new wallet and it is still about 1/3 thinner then the old wallet empty. I got the grey color since it will be easier to find then the black wallet I had, and it looks well made and comfortable in the pocket. Can recommend this for anyone looking to downsize the bulky wallet without sacrificing carrying capacity.
customer_reviews.author: G S

customer_reviews.title: Not all colorways are leather.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the “blackish green cross” pattern and it is NOT leather. Maybe some of the 30 different colors are, but this one is definitely vinyl or plastic of some kind. I figured it was not leather when I ordered it, but it kind of sucks that the ad insinuates that ALL of the colorways are leather. That said, it’s good quality and the *design* is exactly as advertised. Because it’s plastic though, cards tend to stick sometimes and the slots that don’t have a push area cutout often cause issues getting the card out. For $13 (when I bought it) or less it’s fine. Just don’t plan on it being leather or a “buy it for life” product.
customer_reviews.author: Lestan Gregor

customer_reviews.title: Great to Look At / NOT For Everyday Use
customer_reviews.text: This was about six months in. Credit card started cutting through the material. Very disappointing. (Irony: It was that heavy-ass Batman-like Amazon Prime credit card that did it in.) Update - 06/15/2019: I held out with it as long as I could. Just threw it in the garbage
customer_reviews.author: Tankus69

customer_reviews.title: Well made and what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Trying to slim down what I carry around; a BIG change for me! This product appears well made, albeit a tad tight to fit cards into, but I expect that might "loosen up" with time, or I'll just get used to it. Allows for three cards with small pouch on one side, and I can fit my licence and another two IDs together on the opposite side. The middle pouch will hold a small wad of bills. After that, the wallet starts getting fat. It forces you to slim down, so if you're one to packrat all your receipts and coupons, think again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: A decent wallet for the minimalist
customer_reviews.text: It has great features. Just a little wider in the pocket than I'm used to. Also a little thinner. Previously I used a business card holder that has lasted many years. I don't expect this one to last as long but it a compromise for its features. The contents are now separate and will not scrape against each other. The cards are exposed in this wallet. The good is It's thinner. The bad is the exposure to moisture and damage. Update: Very pleased with its durability and function. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Boy From The Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed, well-made front pocket wallet
customer_reviews.text: The Buffway front pocket wallet is made with high quality materials, exceptional craftmanship. Just looking at the materials and stitching I am positive that this wallet is going to last and survive the daily use. The compact design accommodates all my cards, drivers license, bills and receipts in a slim, easy to stow form factor. The ID slot has a transparent window with a cutout that makes it easy to pull out the ID. The outermost card slot also has a cutout that enables easy access to your most frequently used card. Overall, a very handy and compact wallet with the form factor that I want, well-made. Highly recommended if you are looking for a slim front pocket wallet.
customer_reviews.author: GMan

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, but....
customer_reviews.text: Just received. Description is accurate — well made, attractive, slim, holds lots of items securely. BUT retrieving cards etc that get pushed down into the various slots is tough — can’t get fingers in to grab it. Going to try keeping 1/8” of each card just sticking out (as in picture), but it’s still a trick to get enough purchase to pull a card out. Should come with tweezers 😄. But it definitely is not a big wad in your pants, nice. So the jury is still out for me. Update a few days later: I gave up on it, just can’t get cards out. Shame, it’s nicely made.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet for the price don't expect long term durability!!
customer_reviews.text: Look, its a great wallet for the money. Actually, its a great wallet for what you pay for it. But you have to keep in mind you get what you pay for... I love the size of the wallet, its slim and fits the cards that I need to carry, a few business cards, some cash etc. Durability, meh. Its going to pull apart at some point. It fails along the seems on the side where you are constantly pulling your bank check card out. Not even mad about it. It was 9 bucks and got most of the year out of it. I'm on my second one, when this one begins to pull apart, I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: JMTB

customer_reviews.title: This is what I have been looking for in a minimalist wallet
customer_reviews.text: You would think it wouldn't be hard to find a minimalist wallet since many of them claim to be so. Then you buy it and it's got extra hooks and folds and stuff????? So frustrating the money I've spent on wallets claiming to be minimalist. Luckily I took the dive and got this one because this is exactly what I want. It's got room for all my cards, and sliders for a couple of pockets, and even a couple extra pockets, and nothing more folding out of it or added on. It's got plenty of room for everything that I carry. Now I am comfortable in my front pocket again. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: RandomTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Not all pockets RFID blocking
customer_reviews.text: I just got this wallet today and really like it for the most part. It seems relatively well made and has plenty of pockets. However, it is NOT RFID blocking in all of the pockets. I tested it out by putting a NFC chip inside and my phone registered it right away in the most exterior pockets. I would recommend something else if your main selling point is the RFID blocking.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Second time buyer, loved it so much I’m back two years later buying it again!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Simple clean design. Durable and practical. I had this wallet for two years and it held up great! Some wear and tear to be expected and I overstuffed it so it ripped in a few places but overall for the price you can’t beat it. Loved it so much two years later I’m buying the same wallet again. Lightning fast shipping. It arrived in just two days and the packaging quality is yet another testament to this company’s focus on craftsmanship. Throw in the one year no questions asked product replacement guaranteed and Buffway is a no brainer. Buy this wallet, you’ll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: David Cummiskey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and just the right size.
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a larger bi-fold wallet to this one and I am impressed. It has the perfect amount of room for my ID's, bank cards, and a little bit of cash without being bulky. It's super slim and fits well in front pockets, back pockets, and even my gym shorts without weighing them down as my previous wallet did. It's actually so thin I often forgot it was in my pocket/ don't notice when it wasn't, but after a few weeks, I got used to it. It's also really well made and I am totally gifting one to each of my brothers for xmas.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Capacity
customer_reviews.text: For starters, this wallet does not fit more than 6 Credit Cards at best, if you try to add more, you will not be able to remove any of them; As it is to remove just one is difficult. Where the thumb can push the card out over one side is forceful, it gets better when hooking up the card with your fingernail. Now on the other side also difficult all in all forget it
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Banzhaf

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Wallet by Buffway.
customer_reviews.text: Money should be in your wallet, not spent on it. This is my second wallet by Buffway. My first one fell apart, but I also stuffed it with more cards than it was meant to hold. Lasted me a good year. Can’t speak to the RFID blocker. But I liked how quickly I could snatch out my card when paying. It’s smaller than folding wallets and doesn’t leave imprints on my jeans, at least not as noticeable nor as quickly. I decided to purchase another color and style, so we’ll see how this one pans out.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Very handy for everyday use and travel abroad
customer_reviews.text: I switched from my bulky wallet carried in my back pocket to the Buffway Slim Wallet when I was setting off on a European vacation. In areas where pickpockets were prevalent, it was reassuring to have all of my important credit cards, identification and cash in my front pocket without detracting from my appearance. The Buffway Front Pocket Wallet is spacious yet discreet, boasting many compartments for organizing currency, business cards and credit cards. There are handy thumb slots on both sides that allow you to push up and extract cards quickly and easily. I've decided that this will remain my every-day wallet now that I'm back home - because you can never be too careful.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N.

customer_reviews.title: Good Design, Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this wallet. Unfortunately it's junk. I have owned this wallet for only 8 months and the majority of that time it has been in a backpack, not in my pocket, so it has been exposed to much less friction and stress than most men's wallets. The wallet is coming apart at the seems (see photo). Even at this price only lasting 8 months is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: BenjaminTop Contributor: Mountain Biking

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry out everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this wallet. I was replacing a worn out traditional folding wallet, which my cards fell out of, and it was too bulky. I looked at few different ones on here and went with this one. It’s awesome. Slips into my front pocket, it’s lightbweight, holds all my cards. I only carry a few. I really like the favorite card slot. I can easily access my debit card using one hand. It has a clear window ID slot. It has two slots for cash or a biz card, etc. it’s great not carrying a bulky, big wallet. It’s very well made too!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Locatelli

customer_reviews.title: Very thin but just a bit too wide but near perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great EDC plenty of spots for cards the viewable iD slot is awesome great to have the spot to push card up with finger makes getting card out easy so you not fumbling around at the register... only downside is the wallet is a bit wider the I like if they trimmed that extra bit off and made it just wider then a card it would be perfect also even with license 5 cards and a few bills in the fold this thing is incredibly thin perfect minimal for front pocket also it is made well not great material feels a bit cheap but can’t ask for too much at this price point...
customer_reviews.author: Official Comment

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I really like how compact this wallet is. It forced me to make a decision and look at the choice of the cards that I carry and I realized many of my cards were cards I seldom used or were for specific stores. I only need that card when I'm actually going to that store. Just know there is a break in period for the wallet as with most leather wallets where the cards will stick to the leather making it very difficult to remove them. I have found squeezing the wallet slightly will pop the card loose enough to allow it to be pulled out.
customer_reviews.author: BossMan696

customer_reviews.title: Very thin, but not quite right
customer_reviews.text: I replace my wallets when they are completely worn out, which means I'll carry the same wallet for several years. I love the thin size of this, and the light weight. However, it really doesn't have enough pockets for my needs (4 credit card slots and 1 for ID are all you get). Also, any card aside from ID and one card are extremely difficult to extract. Despite these shortcomings, I'll be keeping this wallet. I'll probably carry it as my only wallet for the next 6 or 7 years. It's good enough.
customer_reviews.author: 52degrees

customer_reviews.title: Great Wallet!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little wallet & my 2nd one to buy. I had my previous one for a few years before wearing it out. Once I got use to carrying less, I realized that all along I had carried cards I never really needed nor used. Now I carry only those I need & yet still more than you might think since there are more pockets with this wallet than many others you see out there. I highly recommend this minimalist wallet to anyone looking to better organize what they carry.
customer_reviews.author: hearrean

customer_reviews.title: Holds Business Cards
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that it would hold business cards, and it does. The slot beside the credit card slots is tall and wide enough for business cards without bending up the corners. The only thing I'm not crazy about is how tight it is, hopefully that will loosen up over time. Since the sides are just sewn together, there's not really any width to it until you put your cards in, and it makes them a little difficult to get out. Not as bad as my previous wallet though so I'm happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered a few of these after my daughter had her debit card, driver's license and credit card info swiped magnetically at a grocery store (we knew that because about 2 minutes after she left the store someone charged $50 to her Visa and then at the computer parts store in the same strip mall.) This is a NECESSARY purchase, folks. I've ordered from a few different companies for friends and family, but this one is the best quality hands down. Not plastic-y...feels like leather, doesn't rip or tear, colors are really nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Mc

customer_reviews.title: So slim!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of my bulky wallet taking space in my bag, and even causing my jeans pockets to tear after a while. I have a few bills in the center, and have a license and 3-4 cards in addition. The quality is great, but It's easy to remove my license or credit card when I need to. The cards in the back are slightly harder to take out when there's pressure on them, but it's not bad. The front card is very easy due to the little opening for your finger to push the card up.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kfir

customer_reviews.title: Finally, the perfect front pocket wallet
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 front pocket wallets before I found this one but now my search is over. I love this wallet, it fits all my stuff yet is still slim enough for my front pocket. Guys it’s time to ditch the fat fold over wallets that kill your back when you sit on them all day long. Minimalism is in, clean out all those old outdated coupons and business cards and expired Credit Cards and move over to a Buffway Front Pocket wallet. They have styles and colors for everyone, though seriously, it’s in your pocket all day. Still buy one and join 2020 with us cool people!
customer_reviews.author: Todd A Russell

customer_reviews.title: It's like I'm wearing nothing at all
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st slim wallet. It's cool. Can't even tell it's in my back pocket some times. Had to get rid of a couple cards that I didn't use anyway. At the moment I have 7 cards in it and all still easy to remove, and some cash. I could see it being a problem if you a cash person not being able to hold that much. I'm a kid at heart and would love to see wallet like this have some designs to it. My last couple wallets have been comic book themed. so I feel a little boring pulling this out of my pocket lol
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: too wide, feels bulky
customer_reviews.text: I like the thinness, length, amount of pockets, and the finger holes to help you remove cards.. However it is unnecessarily wide and feels bulky in my pocket for that reason. As shown in the picture it is about 0.75 inch wider than a credit card and about 0.5 inch wider than a dollar bill. I see no reason for this. My last wallet was a folding style and was narrower in that dimension. I might try trimming down the middle section to make it less wide but I might ruin it in the process. The wallet is also very stiff.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: I started out as a skeptic...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I bought this on a whim. I wanted a smaller wallet, and this had a nifty look. I had no major expectations of this becoming a long term keeper. I have been VERY happy with this purchase. After breaking down my wallet to what I really need, I found out this product offers me more than enough room for that and more. If you need a new wallet, or you want to get away from the bulk, this product is the way to go. It is inexpensive, but very well manufactured. This will be a keeper for sure, and I will know where to come when it is time to replace it. 5 out of 5
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller footprint wallet. I have tried several including the "high tech" ones on the market. I cannot address the RFID feature though it did not block my security key card for work. Not sure how well it will protect my chipped credit/debt cards but that was not the reason I purchased it. It holds two forms of I.D. my car insurance and medical insurance card, a credit card, a debit card, two punchcards and some cash. All fit nicely without being jammed in there. It also holds my work security key card. I am happy to recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Magmore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, well built and a great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wallet for taking with me on vacation to theme parks. I bought the Sahara Coffee version. I wanted something with a little texture to it so it would be less likely to slip out of my cargo shorts when getting on and off rides. It was perfect. As far as capacity goes I had $200 (20's) in cash, my drivers license, health insurance card, hotel key, debit card, credit card and a credit card knife. Everything I needed fit perfectly and I barely noticed it was in my front pocket at all. Perhaps someday I'll give it a test drive for use as an everyday carry wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Red Hills Woodworks

customer_reviews.title: Color a bit off otherwise perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I like this wallet alot! Now that I only ever use cards with the occasional cash, its perfect! Its easy to carry with my phone if I dont want to bring my entire bag with! It flexibility is really nice too. I feel like I could double up on a card here and there for space! The color is a bit different in person with the one i got. Its more green that pictured about. Im ok with it cause I was expecting a green grey color, but in the light it’s definitely green.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Should have switched to this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I am really loving this. It is difficult to get cards in certain slots out but you learn to deal with it rather than having them fall out on their own (hint: squeeze the edges to help!). I'd recommend this to anyone who can live off very few cards and/or don't like the proverbial 'Castanza' hip wallet. I was tired of the leg pain so I figured this would be a good replacement. I don't know why I didn't switch before. Highly recommend! FYI: 2 debit cards, 2 gift cards, 3 ID cards, 3 med cards, 8 US currency bills, 2 receipts and a couple of post-its.
customer_reviews.author: DashBlastR

customer_reviews.title: all the things that I need in a smaller space
customer_reviews.text: I heard years ago that a fat wallet in ones back pocket can have an effect on our spines. Although I have tried to keep my back pocket down to the essentials, It was still thick enough to be a possible cause of my back pain. I made the switch to the Buffway front pocket wallet and am happy to report that not only is there enough space for my wallet needs, but my back is feeling much better, and it does not seem too weird to make the switch from back to front.
customer_reviews.author: Tristram Night

customer_reviews.title: Tight squeeze
customer_reviews.text: I totally love how small and light this wallet is. It' holds 7 cards and cash without seeming like it is going to break. The only downside is that if you stuff this thing with too many cards it makes it very hard to pull them out. My brand new debit card's chip wouldn't work soon after I began using this and while I'm not 100% sure the wallet is to blame DRAGGING it across the tight confines of the wallet to get it free probably didn't help it. Still happy I bought this, just maybe need to down-size to fewer cards.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: VERY CONVENIENT and holds a lot of cards as well as cash
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way it's laid-out (allows driver's license to be displayed on one side and has a convenient slide opening for any other card one uses on a regular basis). Also has other pockets both sides for a debit and credit card as well as other cards like a Costco Card. Cash is stored (albeit folded) in the middle. Really great and if you don't mind not having photos is much smaller and easier to access than a typical wallet ... will definitely buy another once this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Buffway Slim Minimalist Wallet is my new favorite wallet!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using a great RFID Wallet for years but lately arthritis and leg pain makes carrying this wallet painful. I hated giving up my favorite wallet but the pain won out and I bought a black Buffway Slim Minimalist wallet which holds all of my cards and IDs. Best yet is that I can carry my Buffway wallet in a shirt pocket or front pants pockets. I now carry 3 IDS, 3 bank cards, a medical card and 5 twenty $ bills folded in half. The Buffway is 1/4 thickness of my other wallet. I hardly notice it in my pocket. Cards and cash are held snug. This is a great wallet. 12 month free replacement guarantee is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: kernal

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: I like how compact this is. It forced me to remove a few gift cards and rewards cards I hardly ever use. I love how slim it is. It's hardly noticeable in the back pocket, and when you're wearing gym shorts and only have a side pocket, you hardly notice it there. It looks great and holds everything you need. The interior pockets are kind of hard to get things out of. I keep receipts and can only get 1-3 in at a time because receipt paper is so flimsy. I keep an extra 4 cards in the very middle, and you have to pull them all out to get to the one you want (not a problem at all).
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and cool
customer_reviews.text: The wallet is very simple and looks great. I got the carbon fiber textured one. My only complaint would be that I wish i could have better access to my other cards once i put them inside. The slots are very snug and I have to remove the primary card out first to loosen the other cards. If the hole that was designed for the primary card was also for the other cards, I think we'd have a solid wallet. Also this is just a preference but the I wish the wallet was a bit sturdier. Im afraid I'll fold it in half when I shove it in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: poli

customer_reviews.title: slim and light
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this type of wallet for many years. This wallet is perfect for me as I only carry 8 cards counting my drivers license and use a money clip for currency. The cut out in the CC pocket looks like it will work for tap and touch cards and the inner pocket is good for the little bit of big bills ($50 or $100) that I sometimes carry. It claims to have RF protection and if I ever figure out a way to test that function I will be even happier. Overall I am very happy so far and if this wallet lasts a year I will consider it money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gollner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for minimalizing! I bought 2.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I bought one for my husband because he wanted to downsize and only regularly carry his *important * cards. I found this and ordered him the Sahara Desert Green. Its a soft almost suede like texture and he loves it. I ordered myself one a few weeks later. Mine is pictured and the color is Sand Rose Gold. Its a little shiny but not too little girly. I am loving it. I can easily remove cards that I use often and keep others with me but less accessible. I keep a little cash in the middle. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Hawkyard

customer_reviews.title: 9 months later, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I love this little wallet! I've had it around 9 months now, and it's held up quite nicely. I haven't been gentle, it's been used every day, thrown around, washed multiple times, and left in the rain for several hours. The design is awesome, I really like being able to thumb my card out quickly and easily. I'm never going back to thick wallets, this little guy does the same job with half the pocket space. If I lost it tomorrow is buy it again. Totally worth the $13
customer_reviews.author: PaulAK

customer_reviews.title: Does not block RFID
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product but it definitely does not block RFID. My ID card works through the wallet as well as my bank cards. I first thought the ID card would be a bigger antenna and it may allow that through but I laid my phone on the wallet one day and the RFID was picked up by my scanning app on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Polak

customer_reviews.title: Best minimalist wallet I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak to the RFID aspects of the wallet as I’ve not tested its capability there, but in all other respects, this is the best minimalist wallet I’ve owned. Unlike some others, it does not damage your cards or spring open when dropped (throwing cards everywhere). Also, this holds a small amount of cash better than other minimalist wallets I’ve owned and does so without displaying the cash money-clip style. The only negative I’ve experienced is that the see-through ID holder slot really sticks to my drivers license. It makes it pretty hard to get out. However, this is not atypical for ID compartments of wallets.
customer_reviews.author: MDS

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not durable in the least
customer_reviews.text: Received my wallet on 8/23/18. Not quite 5 months later as it's ripping. I had loved it's size, the ability to hold most used cards, room for cash in the middle pocket... But it's just not durable. I'm disappointed and won't buy this brand again. I expected to get at least a year or so of use before a break down in quality.
customer_reviews.author: 3kidmom

customer_reviews.title: Super slim, but might be a little tight if you have a lot of cards
customer_reviews.text: Before buying the buffway slim wallet, I've used the same bulky bifold for almost 10 years. It wasn't the biggest issue but I realized that it would be so much more convenient to easily fit a wallet into one of my pockets. The buffway wallet fixed that issue for me. Although it does fit all my cards pretty well, they're all packed in there pretty tightly. So when I have to pull a card out or slip some cash in, it takes a little more effort than usual. This isn't a problem for me, but it might be for anyone looking to buy this wallet. I'd say it comfortably fits around 6 or 7 cards.
customer_reviews.author: Amil

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and was looking for something slim and light weight with easy access to the two things I use the most - my driver's license (at TSA and hotel checkin) and my Amex card. This wallet is perfect. I have the license in the see through window which is great at the hotel check in. TSA, of course, makes me take it out of the wallet but with the handy thumb slide, I can do it with one hand. The credit car slot can also be accessed easily with a thumb slide. For the price, the quality is quite good. I bought two (just different colors) and would recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: DJW

customer_reviews.title: Great, and no bulk!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for one I’d had about two years, and mistakenly washed in my jeans pocket. The old wallet was still holding up, but not the same unfortunately. Sweat does not seem to harm the wallet, so it would have to be a real soaking to alter it. They are great wallets and very slim for front pocket wear. Mine has cards in all the slots and I carry cash in the pockets, and still it’s very flat. I love the clear, easy access, ID holder as I need mine all the time. I’ll keep buying them as long as they keep making them.
customer_reviews.author: Rough-N-Ready

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and nicely slim
customer_reviews.text: I am about two months in on this. So far, it has held up - the stitching seems sound but time will tell. Still a fine quality at this price point. All of my 'stuff' fit this wallet (7 cards plus some cash), which is 1/3 the size of my very nice trifold. I will say that two cards are easy to remove but the rest take some digging (and require occasional appeal to deities). there is a tendency to stuff too much in, so be warned yet the "10 lbs of mud in a 5 lb sack" principle seems to hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: It's almost slim enough
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't block my work ID, but that's good, I didn't buy it for that. It's pretty slim. It has unnecessary extra pockets in the middle. And it could be slimmer if it was designed to have cards go in on the opposite ends of the wallet, please create one like this. I like the color and feel of the fabric. So basically remove the extra two fabric pieces in the middle so there are 5 card slots on the outside and 1 pocket in the middle. Then flip around one side if the card slots.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I like this wallet. I was expecting leather but it feels like a synthetic material, but it should hold up and I didn’t pay that much for it after all. Bought this because my previous wallet, even with no cards or cash inside, was very thick and bulky and was an inconvenience to use. And I don’t have that many cards! Therefore, this fits my needs perfectly. Even with 5 cards (drivers, visa, and 3 gift cards) inside and a few bills (folded in 1/2 to fit inside the money slot) it is still very thin and is pretty comfortable to keep in my front pocket. Huge improvement over my previous wallet. Most definitely a minimalist wallet. I’d recommend!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Small package, big bang
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe it when I consolidated the contents of my tattered billfold into this tiny wallet. It's fantastic! What It's holding: -License -SS card -Conceal carry card -Credit card -Debit card -2 gift cards -Health and car insurance cards -Small stack of cash -A magic trick ($2 window) The wallet design itself is awesome. Now it's just a matter of durability. With a 12-month guarantee I'm not worried.
customer_reviews.author: M. F. Brink

customer_reviews.title: Low price - you get what you pay for...(UPDATE!!)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wallet in February 2019, and was initially very pleased with it. Then the ID card started "sticking" in the slot and took way too much effort and time to get out. After six months, it started splitting. I've contacted Customer Service at Buffway. How they handle this may improve the review, since it's possible I got an outlier, and not a representative produce. UPDATE: When I originally submitted this review in August 2019, I took advantage of Buffway's 12 month replacement policy, and I've been carrying the replacement wallet for the past year. MUCH BETTER! I would recommend this wallet to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Dale W.

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Small Wallet
customer_reviews.text: The graphite finish is very nice, visually. The wallet feels well-made and the construction/seams look very good. I carry 2 IDs, 4 cards and usually carry about $10 - I currently had 5 bills in it. And the size is still small. I really like the pocket for bills rather than the competitors' money clips; I don't like flashing money when I pull my wallet. Fits perfectly in my jeans front pocket and doesn't pinch while I drive. Very pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Vic

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: I have had this wallet almost 2 years (seriously, today is 6.1.20 I bought this 6.11.18) In the past year I did not "actively" use it. I have been using it as a secondary wallet that I mostly keep home. But I pulled it out today! Still in excellent shape ( a lil stretched, but that's expected of course) No tears or rips. Never had a problem. Read other reviews that confirmed the rfid works but I have no way to test on my own. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ari's mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Build Quality with fine leather
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of carrying around a big fat wallet and decided to slim down with a minimalist wallet and this Buffway Slim fit my requirements perfectly. The RFID blocking is an added bonus to protect my RFID cards from stealth scans. About the wallet, it is rugged, the stitching is firm and the leather is strong, and it has lots room for the ESSENTIALS and no more. You will not be stuffing receipts into this wallet and there is little room for cash. You won't find a better choice for a minimalist wallet than this one.
customer_reviews.author: The Dragon!

customer_reviews.title: Slim, minimalist, and constructed well.
customer_reviews.text: I really, really, like this wallet! Slim as advertised, no bulk whatsoever. Holds cards snuggly with cut-outs that make them easy to slide up with a finger or thumb. I keep a wallet size multi-tool in the center, license, metro pass, ccs, etc. Just well deigned /layed out, seems quality so far (purchased two in December 2019, one was a gift) and at this price point? No Brainer, I think you'll be pleased. I chose yellow just for something non traditional. It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: E. Pinder

customer_reviews.title: Great slim wallet.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it I wasn't impressed. It's a little larger than I expected. Not thick but large. 3 month into using it I absolutely love it. Holds 3 credit cards, drivers license, ID card, MetroCard and 5 bills perfectly. (And that's what I carry). Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is for the I D card to fit the window correctly it will bend the card at the end (toward last 1/2" edge of wallet). For the money it's certainly unbeatable. Even at 4x the price I'd go for it.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: love the 'slide out' section
customer_reviews.text: slender - perhaps a bit too much for holding folded cash - but the big advantage is that slot in front. If, like me, you live by the debit card & use it for damn near everything, the little cut-out enables you to bypass that 'dig it out of there' problem. You just put your debit card in that slot, & poof, out it comes with a little nudge. Sweet. Definitely would recommend this item; good quality leather, (did i mention slender) plenty of slots for cards, a couple of VERY skinny pockets to hold - at most - 3 or 4 business cards. What more does one need?
customer_reviews.author: J_Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Finally a wallet that works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I must have purchased at least three metal wallets this past year and they all fell apart and I had to carry a separate money clip for cash also. This wallet is great! It holds all my cards at least seven and has a place to carry cash. My cards fit smugly in the pockets and have been a little hard to retrieve but I'm sure this will get better with use and the flexibility of the leather improves over time. I really can't express how much I love this wallet, it is small and fits into my front pocket without leaving a bulge and carries everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Woof Y'all

customer_reviews.title: i love that i made the switch
customer_reviews.text: i'm really glad i made the switch to a slim wallet. it forced me to only carry what i REALLY need. i used to carry ALL my cards in my wallet, and a bunch of receipts and other crap, "just in case" i needed it someday. its been about 3 months, and i have not had that "just in case" moment. i do have a second "metal card wallet" that I leave at home. when i know I'm going to need it, i bring it along. if you're nervous about making the switch, dont be, you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Oliva

customer_reviews.title: Nice wallet, easy to use, not RFID blocking.
customer_reviews.text: I did a test. Put one credit card inside. In the slot with the finger hole so I can get it out when needed. Use it at the checkout line, and lay the wallet on the card scanner. Scanner was able to read the RFID on the card inside the wallet just fine. Grrr. I was hoping that it would actually keep my cards secure in my wallet from wireless skimming, but that's not the case. Other than that, I like this wallet, it's a bit taller than typical flat wallets so I can keep some business cards in it and not have to fight to get them out.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Burokas

customer_reviews.title: Physical comfort vs convenience...
customer_reviews.text: I am 71. My larger back pocket leather wallet was creating an occasional sciatica like pain in my left hip area. This more compact wallet has already largely eliminated that discomfort. I varyingly carry it in both the front or buttoned back pockets. - I carry a lot of cards, etc. and find most things much more difficult to remove at will. Perhaps things will loosen up over time. I have only used for about a week so far. - It has been significant in resolving a Very uncomfortable situation for me.
customer_reviews.author: Red Cholla

customer_reviews.title: looks good and mostly performs as designed
customer_reviews.text: It is a good looking wallet for the style. Appreciate the front plastic for ID as well as the thumb hole to push cards out of the back pocket. Compared to a few others that i have used, it does have more overhang on the sides of the cards. Also it does seem to stretch fairly easily and friction will not hold the cards in if you occasionally go with fewer than the maximum cards youve had in there. This is especially an issue with the metal card that i have given its weight. RFID blocking functionality does not work. I keep my building key card in it and it works through the wallet quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Slim carry is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Do to back problems, I can no longer carry my wallet in my back pockets. Since I received my Buffway slim wallet I now keep everything in my front pocket. I have been surprised by the comfort of not having to be uncomfortable setting on my old wallet in my back pockets. I may even get another Buffway Slim wallet so that some day, if I wear this one out, I will have a spare and I will never have back pain caused by my old lumpy wallet carried in my back pockets.
customer_reviews.author: J W. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Good for Cards.
customer_reviews.text: I will be traveling internationally and wanted something to carry in a front pocket. This is a nice card holder although it does not seem like it will hold much cash before bulking out. Also if the money is larger than US dollars will not fit well. That said the hole opening in the front and back make it easy to remove common use cards or license and overall should hold more than enough cards that I want to carry. The stitching seems tight and durable and the color was as described.
customer_reviews.author: From the 808

customer_reviews.title: It didn't block my credit card from being scanned... FAIL.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these as gifts for Christmas this year and 1 for myself. I was going to pay for something at CVS and decided I'd test the wallet out on the credit card tap payment. And to my surprise the machine still read my card. I thought this was supposed to block RFID.
customer_reviews.author: J@zZy1

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet
customer_reviews.text: This wallet was easy on my wallet and on my back. Over the last few years, my Chiropractor has pointed out that the problems with my posture have been linked to me keeping a wallet in my back pocket. Now, with all my essentials in my front pocket, I can still stand tall and look sharp!! What makes this wallet great is its minimalist design. If you are like me and are looking for a good front pocket back saving wallet, this one is it.
customer_reviews.author: Rcdkey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this product. I needed something to hold a couple of credit cards, IDs, and cash, so, I picked this up on sale. Now I just slip this in my shirt pocket at work instead of loose cards. Being scan proof is a bonus. The construction is acceptable for the price. If you are looking for a front pocket or shirt pocket wallet, this is as good as most of the others and for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McKeehan

customer_reviews.title: Great exactly what I was looking for in the way of a minimal wallet
customer_reviews.text: I do not carry a lot of cards around so was looking for a minimalist wallet. I am very happy with this one as it easily accommodates my license and the three credit cards i normally carry. About my only concern is the leather is slippery and I am afraid unlike my bigger wallet it may slip out of my pants pocket. Would actually prefer a fabric less slippery wallet but have not found one that works as well as this one.
customer_reviews.author: skidoctor

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Back Saver
customer_reviews.text: My son looked at my wallet and said 'no wonder you have back problems' due to the thickness. I realized I did not need to carry everything everyday. Searching through the dozens of options I found this Buffway option. For $10 I went ahead and ordered it. It is very convenient, although I sometimes forget it is there due to the slim size. It is holding up very well and I appreciate the quality and value. With a 12 month warranty I expect it to keep holding up as nicely as it has so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Wood

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wallet but only good for 4-5 months and needs replacing
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the Slim Minimalist 2X now and it the design is great, love it. BUT...... the unit only lasts for about 4-5 months and then is in need of replacement. The seams give out and pull apart. I do not overload this wallet but it is almost like it just falls apart at the stitched seams. In the wallet there is a 12 Month Free Replacement Guarantee but NO CONTACT INFORMATION!!!! They have since contacted me and are very open to replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Loveland

customer_reviews.title: Respectable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just over 2yrs ago. Have to admit it worked great up to the point the material it's made of started to crack and come apart at the edges. I would have expected to get 10yrs from a wallet but i guess i shouldnt expect that at this price. Otherwise was great. 6/23 changed from 3stars to 4stars since I forgot the price for this wallet was under$13 and the failure was on the edges so the wallet still functioned fine. I feel that 2yrs for >$13 is nothing to cry over. I did buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Special-K

customer_reviews.title: Nice slim wallet option
customer_reviews.text: Very nice slim wallet. The material does not feel cheap. Does not hold a whole lot but I guess that’s the point right? It definitely forces you to choose just only necessary items to hold. I’ve been using it as my work wallet since it holds the essentials that I need for the day and isn’t bulky in my Back pocket. I chose a dark brown color that looks a little more traditional and I’m satisfied with what I got in person, sometimes items look one color in the picture description and they end up looking completely different when you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay vee

customer_reviews.title: Nice wallet, but it won't last long
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was really impressed with the quality of this wallet.. but the seams at the bottom of the credit card holder have busted after using it for only four months. Wallets usually last me at least a year, so needless to say, I'm pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cherrific

customer_reviews.title: Love this wallet but wish it would last 2 years or more.
customer_reviews.text: I love this wallet but it only lasted 16 months, so I just ordered another wallet with the same design but a different brand which is $2.50 less. I used this wallet everyday but the slots have torn apart to the point where I couldn’t safely use it any longer. It started to happen a few months ago, but too late to complain! LOL. I just wish it would last at least 2 years, oh well. I guess nothing will last forever including myself on this earth! Namaste
customer_reviews.author: S. Halim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the money. Solid front pocket wallet.
customer_reviews.text: Great size for my front pocket. Cards fit securely, but still able to remove them for use without any trouble. It's made well. The stitching feels good and tough. It's not actually overly minimalist, has enough handy spots for bills, cards, maybe a few guitar picks. It's not the kind of leather that smells like (or will patina like) memories of your grandad. But that shouldn't be what you're really looking for at this price point. tldr: well-made, secure, smallish wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Compton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Quick Runs to the Party Store!
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this product and the family-owned company . My expectation was that this wallet was aniline-dyed leather - it is not. (There was no deception by the seller. I simply made an incorrect assumption.) Like most wallets in this price range, it is protected leather (finished with a heat-set, colored coating), which is fine. The craftsmanship is excellent, and the wallet has a one year, no questions asked exchange program for failure due to workmanship. Pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan K. Koets

customer_reviews.title: Almost great, but cards get stuck in the slots
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the size, construction and capacity of this wallet. It's about perfect for my needs. However, the card slots are very tight and on the side with 3 slots, the bottom slot is almost impossible to get the card out of. Even with the notch in the bottom so you can push, it takes some real wiggling and force to get it out every time. The second slot also sticks but it's a little easier to get it out. I do wonder if it's because I got the non leather material, I don't know, but it makes it a real pain to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing does what it's supposed to do. It's cheaply made and definitely not leather, which isn't a surprise at $10. I bought another one for a friend of mine - he elected to get the $16 brown variant, which is made of an unfinished faux leather type of material vs the very shiny vinyl version I got. His is much nicer for the added $6 so if you're looking at these, I'd go that route.
customer_reviews.author: J. Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: Not RFID blocking - but well made and love the slim profile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the slim profile and RFID blocking. My number one requirement was RFID blocking, my number two requirement was slim profile. So, the one-star review is due to it failing its main selling point. But I will say that I love the slim profile and I've been using it in an RFID blocking sleeve for a while now and it has been holding up great. Well made. Nothing falling apart. I've had it for months.
customer_reviews.author: pompeiia

customer_reviews.title: Nice little wallet
customer_reviews.text: The wallet is cute, comfortable and doesn’t ride up out of the back pocket of my jeans. Cards are easily removed and replaced. Seems well made. I have no way of knowing if the blocking works. And the low price is hard to beat. The number of people complaining about bad stitching etc seems about normal percentage for factory work. I deducted a star because the complainers didn’t seem to get much positive response from the company. If it falls apart for me after a few months, I will add a comment and reduce rating, but for now I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Whaledream

customer_reviews.title: Light and very practical
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty thin. It forces me to keep just the really important things in it for fear of stretching it out too much, for some reason. But it does hold very well. Looks very nice. This will be my second one as the other one lasted about 13 months before I decided I needed another one. I did however fill it with so much extra stuff that didn’t belong in it though , so this time I plan on taking better care. I did love it so much that I gladly ordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: elric

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for the minimalist. But.
customer_reviews.text: If break a $100 bill you will have a hard time fitting it in this wallet. However, for the minimalist, this is a positive. Similar wallets have a bulky magnetic clip. I really love the thumb push cutout. My last wallet like this did not have it and I would always hurt my fingers trying to get a card out.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

product_meta.title: Buffway Slim Minimalist Front Pocket RFID Blocking Leather Wallets for Men Women
product_meta.description:
Most RFID blocking sleeves are bulky & difficult to carry when traveling, but this one has been designed with the modern traveler in mind. Extra slim, lightweight & perfectly portable, 
our RFID blocking minimalist wallet is preferred among men & women travelers looking to lighten their load while still protecting their identity, credit cards, passport cards, licenses, etc. 

 The Buffway Wallet Features 8 Slot Compartments - Plenty of Room! 
- 4 slots for holding credit cards, debit cards, bank cards, passport cards 
- 1 clear window slot with finger glide for ID, work badge or driver's license 
- 2 side-slip pockets for business cards, membership cards, train cards, etc 
- 1 middle pocket for cash bills, tickets, receipts, coupons, notes & so on 

 Minimalist Slim Wallet Specifications: 
3 1/8" x 4 7/16" (1/8” thickness without contents) 
Extremely Thin & Lightweight: 1.05oz 

 ABOUT OUR INTEGRATED RFID BLOCKING TECHNOLOGY: We want to make sure your identity is safe when out traveling, shopping & getting things done. This is why we've equipped 
our genuine leather minimalist wallet with a protective layer that blocks 13-14Mhz electronic signals trying to retrieve your personal information. Thieves use these signaling devices to steal credit 
card numbers, expiration dates, identifiable details & so much more. Using an RFID blocking wallet like ours is the easiest & most affordable way to ensure your pertinent info is safe & secure. Though it effectively guards against common radio frequencies, our id window minimalist wallet doesn't have the ability to block 125 KHz signals such as those for hotel room keys & access cards. 

 No other front pocket slim wallet covers all the bases like this one. Don't let this limited time deal slip away.
